meanings.definition: Lack of wisdom or good judgment.
meanings.sent1: Her imprudence in spending all her money on unnecessary items led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent2: His imprudence in ignoring safety warnings resulted in a preventable accident.
meanings.sent3: The imprudence of wearing shorts in the snow made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The imprudence of trusting a stranger with all your secrets is like handing over your heart to a thief.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of her imprudence echoed through her life like a never-ending storm.

meanings.sent1: The decision to drive without a seatbelt was an act of imprudence.
meanings.sent2: Committing the crime was an act of sheer imprudence.
meanings.sent3: His imprudence in trying to juggle too many tasks at once was comical.
meanings.sent4: The imprudence of jumping into the unknown felt like leaping off a cliff blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: The memory of his imprudence haunted him like a ghost in the night.
